channel.title: SIDE: Simple IDE v0.9
channel.description:
This is a simple IDE I made with the goal of having a full, OS independent, replacement for the jdk in less than 1mb, and I just barely accomplished it because it is exactly 1mb. :)
It does not have a text editor built in, because I didn't want it like that, although due to all the whining in the irc channel one might be added later. One thing that I will add later is a command line option. There are only 2 more things that need to be implemented before this goes to v1.0, and those are both marked with "TODO:" in the sourcecode.
This if fully open source and javadoc'd, please leave suggestions, bugs, fixes, and even things that you coded yourself that could be added to this. One thing that needs done eventually is a better way to run java applications, reflection just doesn't cut it.
screeny: [img]http://img20.imageshack.us/img20/7420/sideshotrr3.png[/img]
[code] SIDE: Simple IDE Readme
Author: moparisthebest
Notable contributors: yakman
You can run this by double clicking SIDE.jar if your JVM is properly configured. Otherwise on the command line running "java -jar SIDE.jar" will work.
Requirements: Sun Java JRE 1.5 or greater. Libraries required to run swing applications.
Developed on Linux, tested on Linux (debian) and Windows XP.
CHANGELOG
Version 0.9 Rewrote Console to support System.in and streams rendered in different colours Fixed bugs Removed ClassAggregator and just used URLClassLoader, now supports loading from jars
Version 0.8 Added a tabbed text editor complete with syntax coloring.
Version 0.7 Initial Release All implemented features should work without error. [/code]
EDIT BY YAKMAN: iv taken the liberty of editing the post as SIDE is now version 0.9
edit: Source mirror: http://up.ht/nqfbde

Moparisthebest:

The error linking is a good idea that should be done, I thought the output area did automatically scroll though.

i ran some tests, and it didnt

like when i compile it will move the area to the [tt]javac …[/tt] line but not to the [tt]succesfully compiled[/tt] or any lines under the [tt]javac …[/tt] line for that matter line

item.title: SIDE: Simple IDE v0.9
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:216, topic:16117”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=24106.msg3113184#msg3113184 date=1264717505]

Download Link? Or is it for a price?

This is oooold

Does it need something new to still be useful?
[/quote]

I know this is a very old topic, but are you still working on it?

(As i just noticed the link your signature)[/quote]

No, in fact, the last version I worked on was 0.8, 0.9 was released by yakman. Doesn’t mean I won’t work on it ever again, I just haven’t for years.

Nueb35:

now that you’ve brought this to the first page, may i suggest linking compile errors and runtime errors to the line in the source file, and automatic scrolling of the output area

The error linking is a good idea that should be done, I thought the output area did automatically scroll though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Killer-99-pkz Killer-99-pkz
item.description:
@Killer-99-pkz wrote:

You’d be better off not making your own Java dev kit becuase java uses c++ (oviously) as a virtual machine so, most of Java’s internal use depends on it. only way you could do what your doing is use Java’s preset native’s. Besides the jdk package is only large becuase of the source bunble. Anyhow, greate job I hope you get far with this.
